content:
Duskville was just like any other town. Unfortunately, that means that for some reason it has exactly 13 inhabitants and a serious Mafia problem. Who will triumph in this totally not contrived battle?

The Players
  1. NicCage (replacing Illume**)
  2. Albert B. Rampage**
  3. mastin2 (replacing AbboTT*)
  4. Mindgamer** (replacing Amished* (replacing Blueberry**))
  5. Espeonage
  6. Guyett (replacing Haschel Cedricson**)
  7. FakeGod*
  8. Lord Mhork**
  9. Elyse
  10. Micc*
  11. Sir Bastion*
  12. Thor665*
  13. Nachomamma8** (replacing jmo16mla**)

Bolded have confirmed by PM.
* = 1 Prod.

Spoiler: The Dead and Game Results
Espeonage, Vanilla Townie, was lynched Day 1.
NicCage, Weak Doctor, was killed Night 1.
Albert B. Rampage, Vanilla Townie, was lynched Day 2.
mastin2 (replacing AbboTT), Roleblocker, was killed Night 2.
Thor665, Mafia Encryptor, was lynched Day 3.
Elyse, Vanilla Townie, was killed Night 3.
Sir Bastion, Vanilla Townie, was lynched Day 4.
No one died Night 4.
Lord Mhork, Vanilla Townie, was lynched Day 5.

FakeGod, Micc, and Guyett (replacing Haschel Cedricson), Vanilla Townies, were killed in the endgame.

Nachomamma8 (replacing jmo16mla), Mafia 1-Shot Ninja, and Mindgamer (replacing Amished (replacing Blueberry)), Mafia 1-Shot Rolestopper, survived and won! Thor665 died and won!

The Rules

1. Rules may be added, removed, or changed at my discretion.

2. If you do not post after 48 hours you will be prodded. You then have 24 hours to pick up the prod. If you do not pick it up after that time I will begin looking for a replacement. Weekends and holidays are counted as normal days. Any player who is prodded 3 times is subject to replacement on the next prod. Prod-dodges buy you 24 hours only.

3. a) The deadline for Day 1 will be 18 days, and all subsequent Days will have deadlines of 12 days. If a Day ends early, the remaining amount of time (rounded to days, not hours) will be added to the deadline of the next Day, up to a maximum of 6 days extra. I reserve the right to extend Day length, typically for the purpose of finding a desperately needed replacement.

b) Night rounds will last for 72 hours. During this time the thread will be locked, and all roles with night actions should send me a message telling me what they're going to do. Nights may be extended, just like Days.

4. Short version: Vote in the form Vote: example. As long as a vote isn't ambiguous, I'll count it. If it is ambiguous it won't ever count, even if clarified. You'll have to redo the vote. Also, unvoting is not necessary.

Long version: Voting must be made in the format Vote: example. The colon is optional, as is the space between the colon and the player's name. Capital letters are also optional. Unvoting is not necessary but appreciated. Votes using abbreviations for player names, misspellings of player names, and even misspellings of abbreviations of player names will all be accepted as long as they meet the above conditions. Abbreviations of misspellings of player names will be treated as mere abbreviations. In the event that a vote is ambiguous however, it will not be counted, not even retroactively. You can vote to not lynch anyone, and the rules for that are the same as regular voting. Trick votes aren't allowed.

5. No invisible or small text (defined as "text I have to copy and paste or quote to read").

6. To lynch in the Day rounds you need a simple majority of votes, or 50% rounded down +1.

7. Discussing this game anywhere outside of the game thread itself is forbidden, unless you are specifically told otherwise in your role PM. Discussing other ongoing games in this thread is also forbidden.

8. If you die you get one contentless "bah" post. Note that if you reach the required majority needed for a lynch then you are immediately dead (i.e., claiming that your death scene hadn't yet been posted so you were allowed to keep posting content won't work). During Twilight (after lynch majority is reached/after deadline hits, before round ending scene) anyone who is alive may post content (but the lynchee doesn't count as alive).

9. Lynch majority will not be reduced at deadline. If a lynch majority is not reached at deadline, No Lynch will occur.

10. Don't quote PMs you get from me. Paraphrasing is your friend.

11. If you are going to be gone for 72 or more hours, say so in the thread, or PM me. This will put your inactivity clock on hold.

12. Don't intentionally lie about out of game circumstances to gain an advantage in the game.

13. Flavor is flavor, no story clues or anything.

14. My color for this game will be teal, so don't use it.

15. In the event that you are modkilled you will automatically lose, regardless of who wins.

16. Do not lie to me about things related to the game.

17. Vote counts will hopefully be done close to the top of each page. If a full page goes by without a vote count then one will be edited in at the top of it.

18. If I make a mistake, tell me.

19. If you have a question about the rules or game mechanics, just ask.

20. Be considerate towards your fellow player. Excessive personal attacks will result in a warning, then forced replacement or modkill.

Note: If you're being insulted, say so in thread or PM me. I'm not you, so I have no idea if you don't care or if you're upset or whatever. Therefore, I will tend not to intervene.

21. If you think something you're about to do might break the rules, assume it will and message me asking if it's okay to do.

22. Alts and hydra components should be made known to me, but I won't force you to publicize the information.

23. And of course all basic game mechanics of a standard Mafia game apply, such as roles and alignment being revealed on death etc...

Public Vanilla Townie PM:
You are a Vanilla Townie, and have nothing but your word and your vote. You win when all Anti-Town players have been eliminated and at least one member of your faction is still alive.

The Game Thread is here [link]. Please confirm by PM.


Public Mafia Win Condition:
You win when all Pro-Town players and any opposing Anti-Town players have been eliminated (or nothing can prevent this) and at least one member of your faction is still alive.
Please stand by.

Role PMs are going out. Please confirm by PM.

12/13 are confirmed, but I'll wait either until Illume confirms or 8.5 hours pass (for a total of 24 hours from when this post was first made) to open up the thread, whichever comes first.

Everyone has confirmed! With 13 alive it is 7 to lynch. Deadline is in 18 days, on December 1st at 8 p.m. PST.

VOTE: jmo16mla

I'm hyped to see Thor, Elyse and Sir Bastion again. You guys are fun to play with.

Before we get down to business, I want to let everyone know that I'll make an effort to be neither passive nor aggressive in this game. Assertiveness is what I'm aiming for. Now I don't always grab what I aim for, but life is weird like that, and that's how we get experience.

What it takes for me to focus, is emotional investment in the game. The sooner this happens, the better.

I like bandwagonning. Lynching is fun, as long as we obey all the rules of mafia theory, and don't quickhammer without a claim, or skip waiting for reactions from other players before hammering. We shouldn't wait until the deadline to decide on a lynch. A proactive town on Day 1 will make a significant difference.

Lately, many games I've played have required multiple Day 1 replacements. Please be active. Don't be afraid to place someone at L-1. The worst thing that can happen is that we all lose interest, and then, nobody is having fun, nobody is trying, and the scum control the lynch. Let's not let that happen.

This is new.

Join me on the off topic wagon of RVS derail punishment.

Most of my thoughts are logged in the Moderator/Dead QTs.

Here's my original conception of this setup's core idea, as quoted from the review QT:
The Mafia 1-Shot Rolestopper cannot kill and rolestop in the same Night. As far as I can tell, there are no confusing interactions between the Rolestopper and the Roleblocker because of this.
If the Weak Doctor targets a Mafia member, but is roleblocked or rolestopped, then the Weak Doctor will not die.
The Mafia 1-Shot Ninja is a complete red herring, and affects nothing in the game.
The core idea behind this setup is to have somewhat unusual power roles who have a chance to interfere with each other. The Weak Doctor is less powerful than a Cop, in that the results are less trustworthy; I believe that a competent Weak Doctor will realize this, especially if the Roleblocker or Rolestopper flip. The compensation for this reduction in investigative power is that the Mafia have no counter to the protection ability other than attempting to kill the Weak Doctor. The Roleblocker's power is limited in comparison, but does gain significant usefulness in the event that only 1 Mafia member remains.

The Encryptor doesn't really play into this dynamic, but it does give the Mafia a boost in the day game, since their night game is relatively weak.

A Bastion lynch would have been just as likely. However, Elyse's assertiveness managed to swing the mood towards you by convincing FakeGod, who convinced Guyett. I felt it was a shame we did not get the chance to go for the Bastion lynch and instead were confronted with an unexpected lolhammer, hence why I said 'Losing Thor felt unnecessary'.

Good game, everyone.
